parameters.name: ProjectOnPlane
parameters.description: True to project the curves onto a plane, false to not (see Remarks )

parameters.name: Curves
parameters.description: Array of 3D trimmed curves that form the outline

parameters.name: TopolEntities
parameters.description: Array of topological entities associated with the outline

parameters.name: Outline
parameters.description: Array of integers indicating which curves belong to which outline

title: IModeler.GetBodyOutline2
description: Gets the curves that form the outline of a body.
signature:
System.Int32 GetBodyOutline2( 
   System.Object
BodyList
,
   MathVector
Direction
,
   System.Double
Tolerance
,
   System.Boolean
ProjectOnPlane
,
   out System.Object
Curves
,
   out System.Object
TopolEntities
,
   out System.Object
Outline
)

parameters.name: ProjectOnPlane
parameters.description: True to project the curves onto a plane, false to not (see Remarks )

parameters.name: Curves
parameters.description: Array of 3D trimmed curves that form the outline

parameters.name: TopolEntities
parameters.description: Array of topological entities associated with the outline

parameters.name: Outline
parameters.description: Array of integers indicating which curves belong to which outline

returns: Number of curves that form the outline
remarks:
When rendered, the array of curves returned in Curves might not display as a continuous outline of the body.
To close gaps:
Call this method with ProjectOnPlane = true.
Post-process the array of curves returned in Curves to interpolate the end points of each curve to generate a continuous outline of the body. See the
Get Body Outline
examples.

examples.title: Get Curves that Form Outline of Bodies (VBA)
